Urethritis or cervicitis: treatment of probabilistic gonococcal and chlamydial infection

- Ceftriaxone single dose IM or IV 1000 mg

- Doxycycline 200 mg PO 7 days (or azithromycin 1g single dose)

question.title: What is the recommended treatment for probabilistic gonococcal and chlamydial infection?

option_a.title: Ceftriaxone single dose IM or IV 500 mg
option_a.description: A common antibiotic used to treat gonorrhea

option_b.title: Doxycycline 200 mg PO 7 days (or azithromycin 1g single dose)

option_c.title: Ceftriaxone single dose IM or IV 1000 mg and Doxycycline 200 mg PO 7 days
option_c.description: A combination of antibiotics used to treat gonorrhea and chlamydia

option_d.title: Erythromycin 500 mg PO 7 days
option_d.description: An antibiotic used to treat some sexually transmitted infections

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
